metadata.title: CVE-2019-14615 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient control flow in certain data structures for some Intel(R)Processors with Intel(R) Processor Graphics may allow an unauthenticateduser to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14615` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-173-generic - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-173-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-173-lowlatency - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-173-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-173-generic - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-173-lowlatency - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1062-aws - 4.4.0-1062.66
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1067-azure - 4.15.0-1067.72~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1062.66').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1067.72~14.04.1').
